column5: Goat, thanks for the article. What a coincidence, just happens to be we're fishing Lac Seul and were in Ear Falls earlier today picking something up at the hardware store. Been rainy, cold and windy, fishing has been slow. Take Care

Goat,I remember that Xmas quite well.I was only 5 yrs old but the Fulfords had been our next door neighbors when they lived in Dryden,my parents were good friends with Cal & Betty & I played with their children.

Hi blulk . I am wondering if you are referring to blue Lake Ontario, now a provincial park. Before my dad built the homestead cabin on scout lake he bought a lakefront lot on blue lake near vermillion bay. I think it was in 1943 or 1944. He built a cabin there. I was 9 months old. Beautiful spring fed lake but the fishing was just so so. Water was very cold. Almost too cold to swim. Water was so clear you could see down 20 feet. He had friends that we visited often, Gordon and Tina Rutherford in vermillion bay. He made the move to scout lake and built the cabin there while my mom and 6 kids held down the fort at blue lake. Our neighbors at blue lake were the idencranzes, wolds, and doctor Carunthers.
Wow, what a story. Thanks much for sharing. I enjoy reading history of the area, even if some is tragic.
